Articles.Content: I'm looking for a solid player, not too thin but not bulky. Memory amount is not a big deal, but I would like the player to show photos and play videos. I would prefer a nice-sized screen; it doesn't have to be a touch screen. I am interested in Apple as well as non-Apple players. Thanks!
VLC media player is the way to go. Cross-platform for PC, Mac, iOs, Android, Linux. It's free and solid.

when my 4th gen ipod dies im just gonna build my own.

 

i thought most people used their smart phones for this kind of thing.

I assume from the size/memory/screen comments he's looking for a piece of hardware rather than a software player to go on an existing computer.

I quite like the fruit based approach, with iTunes managing a central repository which you synchronise to the device, however I know others who absolutely hate this and want to be able to drag and drop stuff themselves.  Don't tend to watch video on it though hence I have an 80GB classic, although I'm a bit annoyed as it conked out on me last night and thinks I have 60GB of "other" and no music, which as pain as it'll be 2 weeks before I can plug it in to PC again to sort it out.
